文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_025_chunk1
证据片段: In-reactor stress-relaxation tests were done on zirconium alloys with different compositions, grain sizes, heat-tratments, cold-work, and specimen stress directions at $5 6 8 \pm 5 \mathrm { ~ K ~ }$ in a fast neutron flux $( \mathbf { E } > \mathsf { I } \ \mathbf { M } \mathbf { e } \mathbf { V } )$ of $2 . 0 \times 1 0 ^ { 1 7 }$ neutrons $( \boldsymbol { \mathsf { n } } ) / \mathsf { m } ^ { 2 } \boldsymbol { \mathsf { s } } ,$ for up to $8 2 0 0 \ \mathrm { h }$ with initial stresses up to $3 0 0 \ \mathsf { M P a }$

证据片段: initial stresses up to $3 0 0 \ \mathsf { M P a }$

证据片段: The specimens were irradiated in the NRU test reactor in pressurized flowing water at $5 6 8 \pm 5 \mathrm { ~ K ~ }$ and $1 0 \ \mathrm { M P a }$

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_025_chunk3
证据片段: Irradiation growth in pure zirconium, Zircaloy-2, and $Z \mathrm { r } { - } 2 . 5 \mathrm { N b }$ depends on the process by which cold-work is introduced and may be initially negative, that is, a shrinkage, in the first 200 to $4 0 0 \ \mathrm { h }$ of irradiation before beginning steady elongation.

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_025_chunk3
证据片段: Different compositions and heat-treatments change the relaxation rate constant by factors of 2 to 4.

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_025_chunk3
证据片段: The effect of grain size on the rate constant of cold-worked Zircaloy-2 and cold-worked $Z _ { \Gamma } { - } 2 . 5 \ N { } \mathbf { b }$ was found to be small.

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_025_chunk3
证据片段: An operative grain size of about $0 . 5 \ \mu \mathrm { { m } }$ is obtained by multiplying the average width of the $\alpha ^ { \prime }$ -phase needle (0.3 to $1 . 5 \ \mu \mathrm { m }$ by a reduction factor of one half to one third to account for the substructural microtwins.

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_025_chunk3
证据片段: Figure 4 shows a small decrease in relaxation rate constant with decreasing grain size apparently independent of whether the materials were cold-worked or annealed.

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_025_chunk4
证据片段: Stress-relieving (or aging) following cold-work reduces the initial stress drop for all alloys

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_025_chunk4
证据片段: High creep strain experiments have been carried out under irradiation using cold worked Zircaloy-2, cold-worked Zr-Nb, and heat treated Zr-Nb 0.6-in.- diameter tubes

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_025_chunk4
证据片段: Creep strains of up to 9 percent were obtained on cold-worked Zircaloy-2 tubes without failure

文献ID: STP551-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_2nd Volume_025_chunk5
证据片段: Most of the tests have been carried out on coldworked Zircaloy-2 tubing

证据片段: a few tests have also been performed on Zr-2.5 Nb alloy in both the cold-worked and heat-treated conditions
